meanings.definition: (adjective) having small wrinkles or ridges on the surface
meanings.sent1: The old book had a rimpled cover, showing its age.
meanings.sent2: She wore a rimpled dress that added a unique texture to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur looked rimpled after it napped on the crumpled blanket.
meanings.sent4: The rimpled sand on the beach resembled tiny waves frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The rimpled leaves of the tree rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: (verb) to cause small wrinkles or ridges on the surface
meanings.sent1: She accidentally rimpled the paper while folding it.
meanings.sent2: The wind can easily rimple the surface of the calm lake.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to iron the shirt only managed to rimple it further.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully rimpled the clay to create a textured effect.
meanings.sent5: The child's playful actions rimpled the smooth pond water.
